MaskedVictim1.synopsis: Default dialogue for Hydrangea, one of the hag support group players can meet in the Lower city. The hag support group is made up of people who have survived an encouter with a hag, and who have banded together to try to research hags, but also to be there for one another. However, one of their group (the dragonborn), is secretly a redcap and is toying with their minds. The redcap has also, if Mayrina is present, hexed her and turned her into a sheep. If Mayrina isn't present, the redcap has enchanted a doll that is terrifying the group.This dialogue covers a number of states such as 1) Mayrina is present and has been hexed 2) player cured her 3) player has saved Hydrangea and the others from a redcap 4) the hag is dead and Hydrangea rewards them (if no other npc is present) 5) if mayrina isn't present, a doll is terrorising them and she's trying to find it

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_0.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_0.text: Forgive your faithful servant, Vigilant One - forgive my weakness. I could not best the hag.

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_1.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_1.text: I beg of you Helm, let it be true. Let the hag finally be gone.

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_2.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_2.text: Thank you, Helm - for sending your warrior to save us.

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_3.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_3.text: The hag's presence - that vile, evil thorn in my mind... I cannot sense it.

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_4.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_4.text: Helm, I will grow stronger. I will not rest until this land is purged of all evil, you have my solemn oath.

AD_Adrielle_Relieved_5.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_Relieved_5.text: By Helm, has someone finally bested the hag?

AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_5.speaker: Adrielle
AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_5.text: You treacherous bastard! I'll kill you myself!

AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_0.speaker: Kled
AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_0.text: Not the redcaps. Oh, please - not again.

AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_7.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_7.text: You're with the h-hag?! How could you?

AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_8.speaker: Jatlo
AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_8.text: Weep, cry, beg! It doesn't matter - I'm gonna wrap up your innards and gift 'em to Auntie!

AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_3.speaker: Jatlo
AD_DropsDisguise_HagSpy_3.text: Argh - that hurt! Auntie, they hurt me!

AD_Kleidunn_SawHagMaskEquipped_0.speaker: Kled
AD_Kleidunn_SawHagMaskEquipped_0.text: The hag! The hag is - oh. It's you.
AD_Kleidunn_SawHagMaskEquipped_0.context: NodeContext: player has shown up with a hag mask on, panicked and then calm

AD_Kleidunn_SawHagMaskEquipped_2.speaker: Kled
AD_Kleidunn_SawHagMaskEquipped_2.text: The mask doesn't make your brain itch? It did for Kled.

AD_Bandits_Idle_9.speaker: Aideen Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_9.text: Since you're all too cowardly to say it, I will - what if the Steel Watch storm this place?

AD_Bandits_Idle_5.speaker: Hiero Lue
AD_Bandits_Idle_5.text: We run for our lives - I'm not dancing with one of those murder machines.
AD_Bandits_Idle_5.context: NodeContext: a shrug, they'd let everyone die to save their own ass

AD_Bandits_Idle_11.speaker: Jivin Mizzrym
AD_Bandits_Idle_11.text: What if some strays decide to take refuge here? Or worse, the owners?

AD_Bandits_Idle_0.speaker: Aideen Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_0.text: We are in agreement. Anyone who sets foot in here? They die - swiftly and silently.

AD_Bandits_Idle_8.speaker: Hiero Lue
AD_Bandits_Idle_8.text: I'm sorry, your highness. I didn't know you shat on a throne of gold?

AD_Bandits_Idle_1.speaker: Aideen Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_1.text: Cease your squabbling - the Steel Watch are onto us. We need a plan.

AD_Bandits_Idle_3.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_3.text: I say we hole up here - let things cool down a bit.

AD_Bandits_Idle_7.speaker: Jivin Mizzrym
AD_Bandits_Idle_7.text: For once, I agree with the luddite. This 'dump' is a perfect hideout.

AD_Bandits_Idle_13.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_13.context: NodeContext: nervous, but trying not to show it

AD_Bandits_Idle_2.speaker: Hiero Lue
AD_Bandits_Idle_2.text: The cheek of you asking that - they're only on our arses because of you!

AD_Bandits_Idle_6.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_6.text: It wasn't me who blew our cover, it was the bloody warlock.

AD_Bandits_Idle_4.speaker: Jivin Mizzrym
AD_Bandits_Idle_4.text: Me? A feral gnoll in the throes of mating is quieter than you, you blundering luddite!

AD_Bandits_Idle_14.speaker: Aideen Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_Idle_14.text: My friends, do you wish to bring a Steel Watcher down on our heads? Then shut up.
AD_Bandits_Idle_14.context: NodeContext: the voice of cold reason, sharp - will not be questioned

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_42.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_42.text: That's not what a sheep says.

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_15.speaker: Narrator
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_15.text: *Mayrina blinks in rapid succession, clearly trying to tell you something.*

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_47.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_47.text: Don't worry, Mayrina - I'm going to fix this.

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_0.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_0.text: That tells me nothing, you stupid sheep.

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_35.speaker: Narrator
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_35.text: *Eyes - human eyes - stare back at you, begging for help.*

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_43.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_43.text: You're a human? Don't worry - I'm here to help.

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_11.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_11.text: HAH! How'd you get yourself turned into a sheep?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_41.speaker: Narrator
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_41.text: *It appears to be an ordinary sheep.*

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying to say something, shaking head in frustrationNodeContext: Trying to say the word 'doll', can't get it out due to a magical curse. Angry and frustrated, (currently a sheep)

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_30.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_30.text: What are you trying to say?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_23.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_23.text: It's all right - take your time.

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying to say something, shaking head in frustrationNodeContext: Trying to say the word 'doll', can't get it out due to a magical curse. Angry and frustrated,  (currently a sheep)

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_8.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_8.text: Mayrina, it's me - I'm here to help you, all right?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_18.text: Listen to - to me. The doll. The DOLL.
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_18.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth - every single word is an effort. Panicked - trying to warn the player.  (currently a sheep)

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_28.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_28.text: What doll? What are you talking about?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_27.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_27.text: Is this something to do with your hex?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_6.context: NodeContext: warning the player, blurting it out before the spell kicks in. Says 'BAAAH' like a sheep  (currently a sheep)

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_1.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_1.text: What could a doll have to do with a profane hex like this?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_10.speaker: Narrator
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_10.text: *A hex like this would require a focus - a cursed object or idol.*

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_26.speaker: Narrator
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_26.text: *Whatever depraved magic this is, it's beyond your deity's reckoning.*

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_40.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_40.text: The magic here is wildly unorthodox - how could a doll be involved?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_19.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_19.text: This is the last time I save you - do you hear me?

SurrogateMother_SheepForm_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
SurrogateMother_SheepForm_38.context: NodeContext: Actor saying this line - not sfx. Loud, almost like she can't control the 'moo' coming out of her mouth

PAD_VoodooDoll_0.speaker: Player
PAD_VoodooDoll_0.text: The doll! That must be the source of Mayrina's curse - I should tread lightly.
PAD_VoodooDoll_0.context: NodeContext: sees a creepy as hell doll

PAD_VoodooDoll_2.speaker: Player
PAD_VoodooDoll_2.text: The doll! Grabbing it will likely do nothing - I have to negate its magic.
PAD_VoodooDoll_2.context: NodeContext: sees a creepy as hell doll

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_0.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_0.text: The kiddo is kicking up a jig. You feel it too, baby?
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_0.context: NodeContext: hands on stomach. confused, happy

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_1.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_1.text: Bloody hells, my heart - it feels so full. And happy!

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_2.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_2.text: You'll be born any day now - I can't wait to meet you.
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_2.context: NodeContext: hands on stomach, talking to her child

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_3.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_3.text: I think I've decided on your name, too - it's after the hero who saved us. You're gonna love it.
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_3.context: NodeContext: proud smile - talking to her baby (in her stomach)

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_4.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_4.text: I can't stop smiling. What in the hells is going on?

AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_5.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_5.text: You hear that, baby? We're finally safe - all of us.
AD_SurrogateMother_Relieved_5.context: NodeContext: relieved, happy - talking to her baby (in her stomach)

AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_0.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_0.text: I just want to go home - but I can't. Not yet.

AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_1.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_1.text: The Absolute is on our doorstep - this is the last bloody thing we need.
AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_1.context: NodeContext: looking outside - worried about the city she calls home

AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_2.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_2.text: Poor bastards outside have no idea a hag is in our midst.
AD_MaskedVictim1_LookOut_2.context: NodeContext: looking outside - worried about the city she calls home

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_0.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_0.text: Kled likes feeling happy. Kled hopes the feeling stays.

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_1.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_1.text: Kled can travel the Realms, can help people not feel scared of hags. Yes! Kled can do it.

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_2.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_2.text: Kled wants to help people like Kled. To help them not feel scared.
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_2.context: NodeContext: realising he's not useless, and never was

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_3.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_3.text: Kled isn't scared no more. Kled feels... happy.

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_4.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_4.text: Kled feels brave and happy. It's a good feeling.

AD_Klediunn_Relieved_5.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_Relieved_5.text: But why is Kled happy? Is the hag... is the hag dead?

MaskedVictim1_9.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_9.text: Oi! Mayrina's been looking for you. Best speak to her sharpish.

MaskedVictim1_11.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_11.text: I can't believe one of our own was a redcap! Why didn't I see it?!

MaskedVictim1_5.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_5.text: Don't blame yourself - his disguise was excellent.

MaskedVictim1_44.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_44.text: I've seen it before - had a hag mask root itself to my face! I should've known.

MaskedVictim1_73.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_73.text: And the worst part is, this isn't gonna stop. The hag knows about that damn book. What am I going to do?
MaskedVictim1_73.context: NodeContext: a little panicked, but trying to keep her cool

MaskedVictim1_7.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_7.text: I'll be honest, I don't bloody understand it. I just know the cleric was excited about it, said it was a hag's 'deepest secret'.
MaskedVictim1_7.context: NodeContext: annoyed at herself, speaking a little fast

MaskedVictim1_15.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_15.text: It's in a safe in the back - take the damn thing, preferably far away. I didn't sign up for this.
MaskedVictim1_15.context: NodeContext: scared but trying to hide it

MaskedVictim1_76.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_76.text: Look, all I care about is killing Ethel.

MaskedVictim1_26.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_26.text: Wait - the cleric said this was a hag's 'deepest secret'! Something about the 'cold permanence of death' or some shit.
MaskedVictim1_26.context: NodeContext: speaking a little fast, frantic - this could be the key

MaskedVictim1_35.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_35.text: Let's find this hag then - where is she?

MaskedVictim1_47.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_47.text: Not a godsdamned clue - she could be anywhere. Any one of us.

MaskedVictim1_37.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_37.text: There's a safe in the back - cleric hid the book there. Said it was a hag's 'deepest secret' or something.

MaskedVictim1_64.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_64.text: But I didn't sign up for this - take the damn thing, preferably far away from here.
MaskedVictim1_64.context: NodeContext: scared but trying to hide it

MaskedVictim1_59.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_59.text: I'm not getting mixed up in this.

MaskedVictim1_70.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_70.text: You think I want to be?

MaskedVictim1_41.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_41.text: He mentioned a book. What was he talking about?

MaskedVictim1_2.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_2.text: Gods, the book - how could I have forgotten about the book.

MaskedVictim1_24.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_24.text: As long as I have it the hag will never stop hunting me. What am I going to do?
MaskedVictim1_24.context: NodeContext: a little panicked, but trying to keep her cool

MaskedVictim1_66.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_66.text: Why was he even here? Why go to the trouble?

MaskedVictim1_1.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_1.text: You should have known better - this isn't your first hag.

MaskedVictim1_16.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_16.text: My head is splitting - damn hag magic. What was that redcap even doing here? Oh, gods.
MaskedVictim1_16.context: NodeContext: speaking to herself, head is in pain, trying to calm down (just after combat)

MaskedVictim1_13.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_13.text: Mayrina! The redcap might have hurt her - she's just upstairs. Hurry!
MaskedVictim1_13.context: NodeContext: Freaking out, full on anxiety spiral after a fight with a red cap - pulling out long enough to direct the player and the burrying face in hands and freaking out again

MaskedVictim1_25.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_25.text: Not here, or here - where is this bloody doll?

MaskedVictim1_28.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_28.text: You should have 'hag-slayer supreme' tattooed on you. I might know a guy...

MaskedVictim1_20.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_20.text: His disguise was excellent - you couldn't have known.

MaskedVictim1_14.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_14.text: Hags, and their minions, do evil things.

MaskedVictim1_65.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_65.text: You need to do a better job protecting Mayrina.

MaskedVictim1_32.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_32.text: Or maybe I'm not cut out for this.

MaskedVictim1_0.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_0.text: Sorry - don't mind my pity party.

MaskedVictim1_30.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_30.text: Thank you - for stepping up when I didn't. I'm damn glad you were here.
MaskedVictim1_30.context: NodeContext: grateful and also disappointed in herself

MaskedVictim1_34.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_34.text: You'll make the hag rue the day she set foot in this city - I know it. Go get her.

MaskedVictim1_42.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_42.text: Any luck turning our girl Mayrina back to her fine human-self?

MaskedVictim1_45.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_45.text: The hells is Jatlo roaring about?

MaskedVictim1_46.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_46.text: I'll keep an eye out for any more hag tricks, don't you worry.

MaskedVictim1_17.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_17.text: Our girl Mayrina is in a bind - and I'm praying you can figure out this hex.
MaskedVictim1_17.context: NodeContext: familiar, player is a comrad in arms

MaskedVictim1_19.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_19.text: Have you seen a doll around here?

MaskedVictim1_27.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_27.text: Thought I spotted something doll-like in the back, but it was only for a moment. Can't say for sure.
MaskedVictim1_27.context: NodeContext: unsure, but not dismissive -knows if the player brought it up it was for good reason

MaskedVictim1_63.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_63.text: A sheep is fine. Mayrina's suffered worse.

MaskedVictim1_72.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_72.text: True, but there's a reason it's a straw that breaks the worg's back. She needs help - and fast.

MaskedVictim1_8.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_8.text: I'm surprised to see you tangled up with a hag again.

MaskedVictim1_48.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_48.text: Well, it was stick around or curl up into a ball and cry - which is still on the cards.

MaskedVictim1_22.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_22.text: Mayrina better come out of this in one piece. Hag magic leaves scars - ones that aren't so easily healed.
MaskedVictim1_22.context: NodeContext: thinking of her own run in with ethel (ethel forced her to wear a mask of roots and serve her)

MaskedVictim1_75.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_75.text: You should leave while you still can.

MaskedVictim1_43.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_43.text: I don't leave friends in witch's claws.

MaskedVictim1_55.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_55.text: Haven't seen you since you saved my hide from Eth - from the hag. But we've no time for a drink and natter.
MaskedVictim1_55.context: NodeContext: can't say 'ethel' too traumatised since the hag. Regardless, determined, no nonsense

MaskedVictim1_77.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_77.text: We need to find the doll - now, before its hag magic gets its teeth in us.

MaskedVictim1_6.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_6.text: How do you know this is the work of a hag?

MaskedVictim1_38.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_38.text: It's a creepy doll that pops up to scare the skin off of us - of course it's a hag. Who else would be that deranged?

MaskedVictim1_56.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_56.text: Where have you seen the doll?

MaskedVictim1_4.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_4.text: Upstairs, downstairs - all over the place.

MaskedVictim1_54.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1_54.text: If this is the work of a hag, I'm surprised you're still here.

MaskedVictim1_71.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_71.text: But a certain someone showed me that hags aren't invincible. So let's find this damn doll, and prove that we won't be so easily beaten.

MaskedVictim1_57.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_57.text: I've had a splitting headache since I woke up in the hag's lair.
MaskedVictim1_57.context: NodeContext: voice peaceful - she knows something is changed

MaskedVictim1_49.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_49.text: But it's gone - I can think clearly. The hag - no. Ethel is finally dead, isn't she?
MaskedVictim1_49.context: NodeContext: this is the first time she's said ethel's name aloud - big moment for her - she's not scared, not anymore

MaskedVictim1_60.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_60.text: I wish Mayrina could see this - she'd be dancing with me on Ethel's grave.

MaskedVictim1_51.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_51.text: My grandkids are going to be sick of hearing about the time I met the greatest hag-slayer of them all. Thank you.

MaskedVictim1_58.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_58.text: Mate, I'm so bloody sorry for coming at you. I'd no idea the dragonborn was one of the hag's.
MaskedVictim1_58.context: NodeContext: grim - she attacked the player

MaskedVictim1_12.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_12.text: I should have known something was up with that sleazy shit. I should've stopped him!

MaskedVictim1_68.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_68.text: Breathe, come on - get your head together.
MaskedVictim1_68.context: NodeContext: speaking to herself, head is in pain, trying to calm down

AD_HagKilled_HagSpy_0.speaker: Jatlo
AD_HagKilled_HagSpy_0.text: SHE'S DYING! AUNTIE ETHEL, NO! COME BACK!
AD_HagKilled_HagSpy_0.context: NodeContext: Jatlo is dying as Auntie Ethel is being killed by the player. In pain, screaming

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_7.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_7.text: Eyes up - we've got a dirty stray.
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_7.context: NodeContext: spotted player, ready for a fight

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_0.speaker: Hiero Lue
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_0.text: Wondrous - I could do with a dance partner. I'm dying of boredom in here.
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_0.context: NodeContext: about to enter a fight, excited

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_2.speaker: Aideen Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_2.text: Enough talk - kill the intruder, then hide the body. Quickly.

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_3.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_3.text: You heard the boss - time to die, little stray.

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_1.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_1.text: Quit your fancy talk, bard. Let's just kill the bastard.

AD_Bandits_CombatStart_5.speaker: Maggie Ni Chuirc
AD_Bandits_CombatStart_5.text: And there ain't no room for strays in here.

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_0.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_0.text: Don't tell me the witch is finally dead and gone?!

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_1.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_1.text: I can see my kids again, my grandkids! Gods, it's been so long.

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_2.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_2.text: My headache - it's gone. What in the hells?

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_3.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_3.text: I ain't felt this good in a long, long time.
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_3.context: NodeContext: happy smile, relieved it's all over

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_4.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_4.text: With Ethel dead and gone, it's finally time to go home.

AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_5.speaker: Mask of Regret
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_5.text: I ain't felt this good since before Ethel nabbed me - wait. No way.
AD_MaskedVictim1_Relieved_5.context: NodeContext: realising ethel might be dead

AD_Praying_Adrielle_0.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Praying_Adrielle_0.text: The hag is evil incarnate. Helm, let us not fall to such a monster, I beg of you.

AD_Praying_Adrielle_1.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Praying_Adrielle_1.text: Vigilant One, your humble cleric seeks the power to defend these innocents against the hag.

AD_Praying_Adrielle_2.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Praying_Adrielle_2.text: Helm, if I am not worthy, let my life alone be the one the hag takes.

AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_0.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_0.text: Keep us from the hag's gaze, Vigilant One - I beg of you.

AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_1.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_1.text: Helm, forgive me - how could I have missed the signs?

AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_2.speaker: Adrielle
AD_Adrielle_HagSpyBetrayal_2.text: To think the hag would go to such lengths to find us...

AD_Cured_SurrogateMother_0.speaker: Mayrina
AD_Cured_SurrogateMother_0.text: Argh - it was the dragonborn. The dragonborn hexed me!

SurrogateMother_Cured_49.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_49.text: That lying, thieving, scaly little shit. I can't believe I let a hag hurt my own people. Again.

SurrogateMother_Cured_103.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_103.text: All this blood - and for what? It's just fun and games to her. Damn it all.

SurrogateMother_Cured_151.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_151.text: Mayrina? What are you doing here?

SurrogateMother_Cured_182.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_182.text: I'm hunting a hag - what else?

SurrogateMother_Cured_133.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_133.text: Care to explain what the hells is going on here?

SurrogateMother_Cured_95.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_95.text: Sorry, I'll start at the beginning.

SurrogateMother_Cured_90.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_90.text: After you saved me from Ethel, I was ashamed - of how stupid I was. How helpless.

SurrogateMother_Cured_135.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_135.text: I'm sorry for hurting your friends.

SurrogateMother_Cured_82.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_82.text: It's not your fault - it's Ethel's. She's after me - and for good reason.
SurrogateMother_Cured_82.context: NodeContext: grim, tired, heartboken but doesn't blame player

SurrogateMother_Cured_191.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_191.text: It's not your fault - it's mine. There's a hag hunting me - and for good reason.
SurrogateMother_Cured_191.context: NodeContext: grim, tired, angry at herself

SurrogateMother_Cured_137.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_137.text: Unfortunately. I stuck my nose in a hag's business, and she hexed me in return.

SurrogateMother_Cured_101.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_101.text: Unfortunately. I stuck my nose in Ethel's business, and she hexed me in return.

SurrogateMother_Cured_153.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_153.text: This is the last time I save you, understand?

SurrogateMother_Cured_51.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_51.text: Any luck? Have you found the hag?

SurrogateMother_Cured_20.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_20.text: At the beginning, I saw a spark of the old Connor in his eyes. But recently - nothing.
SurrogateMother_Cured_20.context: NodeContext: sad, is beginning to think she'll  never get connor back but won't admit it

SurrogateMother_Cured_130.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_130.text: But I won't give up - I can't.

SurrogateMother_Cured_162.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_162.text: Why are you still dragging that corpse around with you?

SurrogateMother_Cured_32.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_32.text: He's not a corpse, he's my husband - the man I vowed to support through sickness and health. And I intend to keep that promise.

SurrogateMother_Cured_179.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_179.text: You don't like it? Fine. But keep your comments to yourself.

SurrogateMother_Cured_117.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_117.text: You need to find her - and soon. Who knows how many people she's hurting?

SurrogateMother_Cured_33.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_33.text: I found the hag - it's Auntie Ethel. She's back.

SurrogateMother_Cured_129.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_129.text: Gods, I should've known. Who else would've turned me into a sheep? To think she's been a stone's throw from Connor and me this whole time...

SurrogateMother_Cured_102.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_102.text: Wait - Ethel's magic turned him into this monster. If she's still alive, maybe that's why he's stuck like this!

SurrogateMother_Cured_17.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_17.text: If you kill Ethel, maybe - maybe he can be human again?

SurrogateMother_Cured_155.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_155.text: It's a long shot but it's all I've got. Just focus on killing Ethel. The sooner she's dead, the bloody better.

SurrogateMother_Cured_124.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_124.text: I'll kill Ethel - that's all I can guarantee.

SurrogateMother_Cured_12.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_12.text: That's all I ask - thank you.

SurrogateMother_Cured_4.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_4.text: Just let Connor die - it's the merciful thing.

SurrogateMother_Cured_18.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_18.text: Just try - all right? That's all I ask. And if - if it doesn't work, I'll figure something else out.
SurrogateMother_Cured_18.context: NodeContext: player has suggested killing connor (zombie husband) might be the only way, she brushes it off with a wave and suggests killing ethel first - she doesn't even want to consider killing connor

SurrogateMother_Cured_194.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_194.text: What?  You mean we've been a stone's throw from each other this whole time?
SurrogateMother_Cured_194.context: NodeContext: just found out ethel, her old hag enemy, is in the city

SurrogateMother_Cured_107.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_107.text: My heart is pounding at the thought.

SurrogateMother_Cured_156.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_156.text: I don't blame you - she's terrifying.

SurrogateMother_Cured_39.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_39.text: Oh, I'm not scared - I'm excited. You can make her pay for everything she's done - everyone she's hurt.

SurrogateMother_Cured_199.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_199.text: I've given you the tools you need to take her down - but I need a favour. When she dies screaming?

SurrogateMother_Cured_166.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_166.context: NodeContext: vicious - this is her payback, this is her moment to get back at ethel

SurrogateMother_Cured_160.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_160.text: Pull yourself together - I'll be doing all the work.

SurrogateMother_Cured_209.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_209.text: I'll keep you safe, don't worry.

SurrogateMother_Cured_74.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_74.text: We're finally free from Ethel - thanks to you. I can't wait to start living again.
SurrogateMother_Cured_74.context: NodeContext: smile - grateful for life. Excited

SurrogateMother_Cured_76.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_76.text: So, you feeling up to killing a hag yet?

SurrogateMother_Cured_59.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_59.text: I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.

SurrogateMother_Cured_99.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_99.text: What have you done?! You BASTARD!
SurrogateMother_Cured_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player snaps the wand in twoNodeContext: Absolute horror, pain and fury

SurrogateMother_Cured_108.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_108.text: Killing Ethel would be a pleasure.

SurrogateMother_Cured_79.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_79.text: She's dead, isn't she? Ethel is dead?
SurrogateMother_Cured_79.context: NodeContext: awe and wonder in her voice

SurrogateMother_Cured_180.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_180.text: She is - but the child didn't survive.

SurrogateMother_Cured_44.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_44.text: I thought we'd finally get a happy ending. But when hags are involved, there's no such thing.

SurrogateMother_Cured_6.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_6.text: At least Ethel can't hurt anyone else. Not anymore - thanks to you. I bet killing her felt amazing.

SurrogateMother_Cured_80.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_80.context: NodeContext: ethel is dead - absolutely ELATED

SurrogateMother_Cured_164.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_164.text: Fuck you, Ethel, you miserable old bat. Fuck you for telling me I'd be an awful mum. That I was nothing but a 'pregnant half-wit'!
SurrogateMother_Cured_164.context: NodeContext: ethel is dead - absolutely ELATED. Shouting at the air

SurrogateMother_Cured_172.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_172.text: Oh, and the girl! You saved her too, right?
SurrogateMother_Cured_172.context: NodeContext: with a jerk, remembers vanra. Excited, convinced player has saved vanra (might have, might not have)

SurrogateMother_Cured_7.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_7.text: I felt it, I think. It was like a piece of glass had been lodged in my chest - and was finally pulled free.

SurrogateMother_Cured_175.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_175.text: And the girl? You saved her, right?

SurrogateMother_Cured_134.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_134.text: I tried my best - but she didn't make it.

SurrogateMother_Cured_157.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_157.text: You hear that, Connor? Ethel is dead! Oh.
SurrogateMother_Cured_157.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to connorNodeContext: turns to connor, big smile on her face - drops at 'Oh'

SurrogateMother_Cured_104.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_104.text: You didn't change back. You're still a... a zombie.

SurrogateMother_Cured_197.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_197.text: I thought with Ethel gone - never mind. I'll - I'll find another way to turn you back. Somehow.
SurrogateMother_Cured_197.context: NodeContext: upset but trying to hide it

SurrogateMother_Cured_122.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_122.text: He's never going to be human again. You have to let him go.

SurrogateMother_Cured_113.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_113.text: I know. Damn it, I know.
SurrogateMother_Cured_113.context: NodeContext: upset, doesn't want to face a life without connor

SurrogateMother_Cured_5.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_5.text: Connor - I love you. I've loved you since we were kids, and you picked me bluebells and asked me to the summer fair.
SurrogateMother_Cured_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: looking at connorNodeContext: crying, remembering how much she loves connor, how long she's loved him

SurrogateMother_Cured_38.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_38.text: But you're gone. And this... thing isn't you. Not anymore.

SurrogateMother_Cured_64.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_64.text: Then why does it feel so terrible?
SurrogateMother_Cured_64.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

SurrogateMother_Cured_22.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_22.text: I can't believe you just killed him.

SurrogateMother_Cured_9.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_9.text: No, Ethel did. I just let him go.
SurrogateMother_Cured_9.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

SurrogateMother_Cured_15.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_15.text: Here. Thank you for killing Ethel, but I'd like you to go now. I'll be fine - I know I'm stronger than this. I just need some time.
SurrogateMother_Cured_15.context: NodeContext: drying her eyes, pulling herself together as best she can.

SurrogateMother_Cured_152.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_152.text: I'm sorry you couldn't save him.

SurrogateMother_Cured_183.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_183.text: Not everyone can be saved - I learned that lesson from Ethel. I just needed you to remind me.
SurrogateMother_Cured_183.context: NodeContext: eyes closed briefly - heart broken

SurrogateMother_Cured_187.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_187.text: No - no, I made a vow the day I married him. And I'm not going back on it just because things are hard.
SurrogateMother_Cured_187.context: NodeContext: briefly considered killing her zombie husband, then shakes off the thought, determined, grim

SurrogateMother_Cured_121.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_121.text: But here - you should be out celebrating. You killed a hag, after all. Don't worry about us, we'll be fine - all three of us.
SurrogateMother_Cured_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands on tummyNodeContext: sad smile

SurrogateMother_Cured_2.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_2.text: You helped me take down Ethel - give yourself time to celebrate.

SurrogateMother_Cured_35.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_35.text: Only a little. But it'll be nice to finally sleep with both eyes shut. Thank you.

SurrogateMother_Cured_10.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_10.text: I killed Ethel for you. I expect a reward. Now.

SurrogateMother_Cured_109.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_109.text: Of course - here. Because of you, I'll finally be able to sleep with both eyes shut. Thank you.

SurrogateMother_Cured_127.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_127.text: Ah - they say revenge doesn't fix anything, but damn does it feel amazing. Thank you.
SurrogateMother_Cured_127.context: NodeContext: shakes head, delighted and a little fierce

SurrogateMother_Cured_123.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_123.text: Ah - I wish I could have done it myself. But you are the next best thing.

SurrogateMother_Cured_138.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_138.text: I prefer my thank-yous to be of the coin variety.

SurrogateMother_Cured_28.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_28.text: It didn't feel so amazing when she was vomiting up a child.

SurrogateMother_Cured_78.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_78.text: A living child. That's what matters.
SurrogateMother_Cured_78.context: NodeContext: wants to make the player feel better, to understand that what they did was amazing

SurrogateMother_Cured_207.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_207.text: Here - call this a small thank you. I look forward to finally being able to sleep with both eyes shut.

SurrogateMother_Cured_89.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_89.text: I don't feel amazing - a child died.

SurrogateMother_Cured_112.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_112.text: Guilt won't bring her back. You did more than anyone else - and think how many children can sleep safer now.

SurrogateMother_Cured_167.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_167.text: This won't fix anything - but take it. You've earned it. And you'll always be a hero to me.

SurrogateMother_Cured_119.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_119.text: Sure did - all in a day's work.

SurrogateMother_Cured_202.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_202.text: I fought and killed her in her lair - it was a perversion of everything natural.

SurrogateMother_Cured_87.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_87.text: Did you find the missing girl's mother? Lora?

SurrogateMother_Cured_204.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_204.text: Keep searching - a hag is behind this, I know it.

SurrogateMother_Cured_53.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_53.text: I did - her daughter Vanra is missing.

SurrogateMother_Cured_178.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_178.text: Vanra? That's a beautiful name. I hope I can tell her that someday.

SurrogateMother_Cured_14.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_14.text: If you find Vanra, you'll find the hag - I'm sure of it. Keep searching - we can't let that monster run loose.

SurrogateMother_Cured_120.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_120.text: Urgh, my mouth tastes like mutton. We're not safe - there's a traitor...
SurrogateMother_Cured_120.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

SurrogateMother_Cured_16.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_16.text: The dragonborn... He's working for Ethel.
SurrogateMother_Cured_16.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

SurrogateMother_Cured_71.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_71.text: The dragonborn... He's working for the hag.
SurrogateMother_Cured_71.context: NodeContext: has just abruptly changed from a sheep to a human. Confused, out of it - struggling to get the words out

SurrogateMother_Cured_145.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_145.text: Don't get your hopes up, but I'm half-considering naming my child after you - you've certainly earned it.

SurrogateMother_Cured_147.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_147.text: So, you feeling up to killing Ethel yet?

SurrogateMother_Cured_149.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_149.text: That lying, thieving, shitty little redcap. I can't believe I fell for a hag's tricks. Again.

SurrogateMother_Cured_192.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_192.text: That lying, thieving, scaly little shit. Thanks for knifing the bastard.

SurrogateMother_Cured_188.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_188.text: That makes twice you've saved me. I'm starting to think you're my guardian angel.

SurrogateMother_Cured_139.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_139.text: Good to see you again, Mayrina.

SurrogateMother_Cured_1.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_1.text: You too. I've come a long way since we last met. Decided I was sick and tired of feeling stupid. Helpless.
SurrogateMother_Cured_1.context: NodeContext: affection in opening line at seeing player, determined for rest

SurrogateMother_Cured_158.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_158.text: So I decided I wasn't going to be a victim anymore.

SurrogateMother_Cured_165.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_165.text: This group is made of survivors - people like me who've been hurt by hags. I brought them together to fight back.

SurrogateMother_Cured_40.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_40.text: We tracked a hag to the city, but lost her trail - right after she snatched a little girl.
SurrogateMother_Cured_40.context: NodeContext: disgusted with herself, feels she should have done more

SurrogateMother_Cured_136.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_136.text: Any leads on the missing girl?

SurrogateMother_Cured_92.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_92.text: None. Her mother has no idea of what she's up against. Poor woman thinks the Fist will be able to help her.

SurrogateMother_Cured_106.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_106.text: Any connection to our old friend Ethel?

SurrogateMother_Cured_210.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_210.text: I bloody hope not - I see her enough in my dreams. No, Ethel is dead - thanks to you.

SurrogateMother_Cured_55.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_55.text: But this one is no less of a nightmare.

SurrogateMother_Cured_83.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_83.text: The moment I started investigating the missing girl, I felt the hag's eye on me. Next thing, I was sprouting wool and bleating up a storm.

SurrogateMother_Cured_118.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_118.text: Wait - is this Lora? She said her daughter disappeared in the Blushing Mermaid.

SurrogateMother_Cured_54.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_54.text: That's her! And she vanished in the 'Maid? That sounds like a lead.
SurrogateMother_Cured_54.context: NodeContext: excited, this is a lead

SurrogateMother_Cured_21.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_21.text: We'll do what we can to find the girl, but our chances are a lot higher with you on our side.

SurrogateMother_Cured_128.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_128.text: Check the safe in the back. I've done my homework on hags since we last tangled with Ethel - take whatever you need. I know it by heart anyway.

SurrogateMother_Cured_85.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_85.text: I met the child's mother - not sure I trust her. Or her story.

SurrogateMother_Cured_62.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_62.text: Have you forgotten how 'charming' I was when Ethel took me? Hags lie and cheat - they'll do anything to mess with our heads.
SurrogateMother_Cured_62.context: NodeContext: sarcastic smile at the beginning (she knows she was a nightmare).

SurrogateMother_Cured_189.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_189.text: I'm already looking for the child.

SurrogateMother_Cured_91.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_91.context: NodeContext: with a smile, player has impressed her

SurrogateMother_Cured_61.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_61.text: A child's life is on the line - allow me to help.

SurrogateMother_Cured_23.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_23.text: I'm here to help - I'll start by speaking to the child's mother.

SurrogateMother_Cured_24.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_24.text: You were going to give your kid to a hag willingly - maybe this is the same.

SurrogateMother_Cured_111.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_111.text: When someone tells you, day in day out, that you'd be a useless mother... well, you start to believe it. Who knows what she's done to this woman?
SurrogateMother_Cured_111.context: NodeContext: looking away in beginning, ashamed of how she fell for the hag's lies. Determined at the end - she won't let lora suffer the same fate

SurrogateMother_Cured_36.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_36.text: Look, I know you're busy with big-time heroics, but we need your help. A child's life is on the line - and her mother is the best lead we've got.

SurrogateMother_Cured_176.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_176.text: Of course - a child is in danger. I will do what I can.

SurrogateMother_Cured_142.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_142.text: Thank you. With you at our side, that hag won't know what hit her.

SurrogateMother_Cured_148.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_148.text: Lora was knocking about Basilisk Gate - at the Flaming Fist's headquarters. Good luck.

SurrogateMother_Cured_11.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_11.text: You'll have to deal with this yourself.

SurrogateMother_Cured_60.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_60.text: Too busy to help regular folk? I get it. But should you ever find yourself in Basilisk Gate, speak to the mother. She deserves that much.
SurrogateMother_Cured_60.context: NodeContext: little hurt, but also determined to help the mother regardless

SurrogateMother_Cured_196.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_196.context: NodeContext: a little smile, knows player is going to be impressed

SurrogateMother_Cured_48.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_48.text: And you can't do this without me because...?

SurrogateMother_Cured_66.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_66.text: I tried - and look where it got me. Chewing hay and shitting pellets.

SurrogateMother_Cured_42.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_42.text: Let me guess - you want me to help.

SurrogateMother_Cured_126.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_126.text: You've seen what Ethel did - imagine the destruction a hag could cause in a city this size? With people this desperate?

SurrogateMother_Cured_143.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_143.text: Does this hag have a lair?

SurrogateMother_Cured_150.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_150.text: What hag doesn't? Best guess says it's close to where the mother lives - but I've no hard evidence.

SurrogateMother_Cured_193.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_193.text: You're on your own this time.

SurrogateMother_Cured_198.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_198.text: No - I'm not. I've got my team. But I understand you're busy with big-time heroics these days. Thanks anyway.
SurrogateMother_Cured_198.context: NodeContext: determined in first line, deflated that player isn't gonna help in the rest

SurrogateMother_Cured_201.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_201.text: Fine - you're busy with big-time heroics these days. Thanks anyway.

SurrogateMother_Cured_100.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_100.text: And it worked - the shitty redcap proves it. Ethel is here.
SurrogateMother_Cured_100.context: NodeContext: grim, determined - wants to get ethel

SurrogateMother_Cured_132.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_132.text: Ah, now that I can help you with.
SurrogateMother_Cured_132.context: NodeContext: happily smug (not in a shitty way), because she knows something the player doesn't

SurrogateMother_Cured_81.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_81.text: I dealt with her once, and I'll do it again.

SurrogateMother_Cured_52.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_52.text: I told everyone who'd listen about you - how you marched into Ethel's lair as if it were a tea party.

SurrogateMother_Cured_185.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_185.text: You're as tough as I remember. And this time, when you put Ethel down, she'll stay down.

SurrogateMother_Cured_75.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_75.text: I don't like having enemies who won't stay dead.

SurrogateMother_Cured_84.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_84.text: Then you're in luck - because I know how to kill her.

SurrogateMother_Cured_30.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_30.text: I know - her existence warps the balance of everything natural.

SurrogateMother_Cured_98.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_98.text: Oh, don't worry. I know how to kill her - and make sure she stays that way.

SurrogateMother_Cured_144.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_144.text: Check the safe in the back. I've done my homework on hags since we last tangled with Ethel - take whatever you need. I know it by heart anyway.

SurrogateMother_Cured_25.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_25.text: If Ethel is after you, that's your problem. You're on your own.

SurrogateMother_Cured_26.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_26.text: Thanks, but my mouth tastes like mutton, and I'm itching in hard-to-reach places.

SurrogateMother_Cured_43.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_43.text: I'm going to make the witch that did this pay. And I have the means to do it.

SurrogateMother_Cured_114.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Cured_114.text: This is the last time - I'm tired of having to save people over and over again.

SurrogateMother_Cured_170.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_170.text: I'm not the helpless brat you met in Ethel's lair. You're looking at one of the Realms' finest hag hunters.
SurrogateMother_Cured_170.context: NodeContext: proud, a little cheeky at the end

SurrogateMother_Cured_200.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_200.text: Stay close to me, Connor - all right?

SurrogateMother_Cured_163.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_163.text: Did you find the missing girl's mother? Lora?

SurrogateMother_Cured_203.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_203.context: NodeContext: distracted, looking over her shoulder

SurrogateMother_Cured_68.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_68.text: Sorry - did it work? Is the hag dead?
SurrogateMother_Cured_68.context: NodeContext: blink, like she's just seen the player, concerned

SurrogateMother_Cured_131.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Cured_131.text: Sorry - did it work? Is Ethel finally dead?
SurrogateMother_Cured_131.context: NodeContext: blink, like she's just seen the player,

AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_0.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_0.text: Kled is safe - unless the hag comes. No, bad thoughts!

AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_1.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_1.text: The dragonborn was a redcap... What if - what if other people are too?

AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_2.speaker: Kled
AD_Klediunn_HagSpyBetrayal_2.text: Kled can't panic. Bad things happen when Kled panics.

AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_0.context: NodeContext: Mayrina is a sheep but she says all kinds of animal noises (sheep, cat, etc). These have to be noises of an animal IN PAIN. Can adjust the spelling depending on what you do!

AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_1.context: NodeContext: Mayrina is a sheep but she says all kinds of animal noises (sheep, cat, etc). These have to be noises of an animal IN PAIN. Can adjust the spelling depending on what you do!

AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_SheepMayrina
AD_SheepMayrina_VoodooDamaged_2.context: NodeContext: Mayrina is a sheep but she says all kinds of animal noises (sheep, cat, etc). These have to be noises of an animal IN PAIN. Can adjust the spelling depending on what you do!

HagSpy_31.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_31.text: Are you here to help Mayrina or simply irritate me?

HagSpy_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_33.text: The more you interrupt, the less time I have to find this wretched doll.

HagSpy_34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_34.text: Convenient - you showing up like this. How do we know the doll that taunts us is not yours?

HagSpy_15.speaker: Narrator
HagSpy_15.text: *There's something strange about this creature. He looks like one of your own, but he smells of blood and moss.*

HagSpy_0.speaker: Player
HagSpy_0.text: There's something strange about you. Are you really a dragonborn?

HagSpy_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_3.text: Well aren't you a clever one, scale-pest. Faster than these idiots, at least. They mean to hurt Auntie - the best and most beautiful hag in the Realms.

HagSpy_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_16.text: I won't have it. I'll carve out your corpse and serve it to her on a plate.

HagSpy_8.speaker: Player
HagSpy_8.text: I found this note on you - who is Auntie?

HagSpy_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_1.text: You dare rifle through my pockets?! You're either brave or stupid - likely both.
HagSpy_1.context: NodeContext: player has pickpocketed jatlo and discovered a note. Outrage then amusement

HagSpy_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_5.text: I suppose there's no point in pretending. These idiots have the book. They mean to hurt Auntie - the best and most beautiful hag in the Realms.

HagSpy_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_18.text: But I won't let you - I will carve out your corpses and serve them to her on a plate.
HagSpy_18.context: NodeContext: vicous, about to start combat

HagSpy_20.speaker: Player
HagSpy_20.text: Let's find the doll first - where have you seen it?

HagSpy_9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_9.text: Upstairs, downstairs, in boxes, atop chairs - it matters not. The moment we find it, it vanishes. This is a fool's errand.

HagSpy_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_45.text: Hmpf. Very well - but I will be watching you.

HagSpy_28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_28.text: The doll follows us. I suggested we split up, but the cleric took umbrage. Let us see how she feels when the hag stops playing games - and the killing begins.
HagSpy_28.context: NodeContext: grim and cold - even at the mention of violence

HagSpy_17.speaker: Player
HagSpy_17.text: If I were with the hag, you'd be dead by now.

HagSpy_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_26.text: I am no novice to battle. You would do well to remember that.

HagSpy_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_35.text: Convenient - you showing up like this. You may have the others fooled, but I shall be keeping a close eye on you.

HagSpy_12.speaker: Player
HagSpy_12.text: Have you seen a doll around here?

HagSpy_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_41.text: A doll? This is hardly the time for childish games - either help Mayrina or leave.
HagSpy_41.context: NodeContext: dismissive, trying to throw the player off the scent of the doll (that he planted)

HagSpy_39.speaker: Player
HagSpy_39.text: Mayrina is an old friend - I wouldn't hurt her.

HagSpy_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_13.text: Then stop wasting my time and go help her.

HagSpy_27.speaker: Player
HagSpy_27.text: Any idea how to remove the hex?

HagSpy_7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_7.text: If I did, I would not be standing here.

HagSpy_29.speaker: Player
HagSpy_29.text: If you don't want my help, just say so.

HagSpy_40.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
HagSpy_40.text: I don't. Leave - and let us deal with this ourselves.

AD_SurrogateMother_HagSpyBetrayal_0.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_HagSpyBetrayal_0.text: I won't let a hag beat me - I refuse.

AD_SurrogateMother_HagSpyBetrayal_2.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMother_HagSpyBetrayal_2.text: I need to research the nature of redcaps - make sure this never happens again.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_61.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_61.text: An intruder? These people are under my protection, I'll not let you harm them!
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_61.context: NodeContext: Surprised, the springs to action - stepping forward, ready to defend the group

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_86.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_86.text: Hearken to my words, wicked creature. Return to the pit of evil from whence you came!

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_41.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_41.text: I found a note in the Blushing Mermaid - it led me here.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_3.text: Don't listen - who knows what spells it weaves around us? Quickly, cleric!

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_58.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_58.text: Helm, protector of all, grant me the power to ignite this creature's flesh and burn its bones to ash. Begone, monster - your hag mother holds no power here!
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_58.context: NodeContext: some kind of hand gesture here like she's conjuring something

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_22.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_22.text: A hag is after you? I can help. I've fought one before.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_60.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_60.text: Then you speak truth? You've fought a hag before?

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_56.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_56.text: At ease, everyone. We may have found ourselves an ally.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_91.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_91.text: Forgive the welcome, but we're being hunted by a hag - the vicious Ethel herself. We feared you her minion. She's already hexed one of us - and any of us could be next.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_91.context: NodeContext: worried - she and the group are in a tense situation with their back against a wall (metaphorically)

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_71.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_71.text: I'm trying to figure out a way to kill Auntie Ethel - any ideas?

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_2.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_2.text: Mayrina - our leader - was on to something. Unfortunately, Ethel found out - how, I don't know.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_28.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_28.text: She hexed Mayrina in recompense - and everything we've done to try to lift it has been for naught.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_28.context: NodeContext: sincere, clearly cares about mayrina

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_32.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_32.text: Mayrina? I know her. I saved her and her child.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_7.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_7.text: Yes. She's spoken of you many times. I confess it's strange meeting you in the flesh. You look so... normal.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_63.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_63.text: She's upstairs, but be warned, she's not as you remember her.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_14.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_14.text: Let me have a look at this hex - maybe I can help.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_83.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_83.text: We've exhausted our spells - I was contemplating salt-throwing and other childish superstitions when you arrived, so I'll not refuse your help.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_83.context: NodeContext: frustrated with herself that she can't do more

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_77.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_77.text: She is upstairs - you cannot miss her.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_81.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_81.text: You've dealt with Ethel? I'm shocked you're alive.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_93.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_93.text: Not myself, but our leader Mayrina has.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_57.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_57.text: Mayrina showed us how to stand on our own two feet - how to fight back. Then Ethel found us.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_57.context: NodeContext: sincere, clearly cares about mayrina

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_68.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_68.text: Forgive the paranoia - we're being hunted by a vile and wicked hag. We feared you her minion. She's already hexed one of us - and any of us could be next.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_68.context: NodeContext: worried - she and the group are in a tense situation with their back against a wall (metaphorically)

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_6.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_6.text: If you pissed off a hag, you're screwed.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_30.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_30.text: Because we dared to do the impossible - we dared to fight back.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_54.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_54.text: I've fought a hag before. No easy task.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_89.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_89.text: Really? You should join us, then.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_89.context: NodeContext: sincere - always happy to welcome someone who has dealt with a hag

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_33.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_33.text: I've fought enough hags for one lifetime.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_26.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_26.text: I've fought enough hags for one lifetime.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_19.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_19.text: Then you see the truth they've kept hidden - that they can be defeated.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_13.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_13.text: You see, all of us here have fallen victim to a hag's vicious ways. But instead of succumbing to despair, we rose above it.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_13.context: NodeContext: determined - she's picked herself up from rock bottom

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_20.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_20.text: Thanks to Mayrina, our leader. Together, we've been helping others who've suffered at the claws of a hag.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_20.context: NodeContext: sincere, clearly cares about mayrina

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_29.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_29.text: Only... Mayrina's been hexed by the very hag who now hunts us.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_29.context: NodeContext: sincere, clearly cares about mayrina

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_50.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_50.text: Mayrina? I know her! She was captured by Auntie Ethel.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_9.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_9.text: You're the one that saved her? The one that ventured to the depths of Ethel's lair? I can hardly believe it - you look so... normal.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_17.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_17.text: By Helm, perhaps there is hope. If anyone can help Mayrina, it's you. She's upstairs, but be warned, she's not as you remember her.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_17.context: NodeContext: hope in the first half, sadness in the second (mayrina has been turned into a sheep)

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_62.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_62.text: Looks like you're in for rough times.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_43.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_43.text: To think like that is to give in to despair, which is exactly what a hag wants - Mayrina taught us that.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_43.context: NodeContext: trying to be determined but is really just sad - she cares about mayrina and is worried for her

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_1.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_1.text: Forgive the paranoia - we're being hunted by a vile and wicked hag. We sought refuge here, but -
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_1.context: NodeContext: worried - she and the group are in a tense situation with their back against a wall (metaphorically)

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doll appears standing upright and rigid

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_8.speaker: Kled
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_8.context: NodeContext: panicked flailing and pointing at the ground in front of him

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_48.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_48.context: NodeContext: stern warning, trying to tell the group not to let it get away

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_31.speaker: Narrator
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_31.text: *Magic infuses every thread - allowing the doll to teleport, curse, and do harm. However, with the right spell, it could be negated.*

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_23.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_23.text: Blast it all. We need to find it, before it hexes us.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Doll vanishesNodeContext: cursing - the doll has vanished and they need to find it - immediately

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_25.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_25.text: Spread out! Tear the house apart if you have to!
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_25.context: NodeContext: a command to the group, gestures to spread out - determined and strong willed

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_74.speaker: Mask of Regret
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_74.text: Wait! I know them. They saved me from Auntie Eh- Eh- Ethel.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_45.text: Lies. I'll cleave you in two and send your corpse to your mistress, scum.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_45.context: NodeContext: serious and determined - combat about to start

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_44.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_44.text: We're on the same side - I'm trying to find a way to kill Auntie Ethel.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_47.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_47.text: Touch me and I'll hurt you more than any bloody hag could.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_36.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_36.text: Touch me and I'll hurt you more than Auntie Ethel will.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_92.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_92.text: Wait! No Ethel spawn would speak like that.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_92.context: NodeContext: confused, holds out a hand to stop the rest of the group from attacking

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_79.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_79.text: Wait! No hag spawn would speak like that.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_79.context: NodeContext: confused, holds out a hand to stop the rest of the group from attacking

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_42.speaker: Adrielle
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_42.text: We will not bow to your evil terror, beast. Helm guide us!
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_42.context: NodeContext: serious, determined - combat about to start

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_66.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_66.text: Wait! I'm no hagspawn - I'm a faithful adherent, just like you.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_11.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_11.text: Stay your hand, Sister - I also worship He of the Watchful Eye.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_52.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_52.text: Come, then - I could do with a warm-up.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_65.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_65.text: Calm down! I seek no trouble!

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_80.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_80.text: What in the hells are you doing?

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_51.speaker: Player
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_51.text: I WILL EAT YOUR SOULS, RAAAAAH.

FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HagSurvivors_HagSpy
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_35.text: I'll send your head back to your mistress, you wretched scum.
FirstMeeting_Adrielle_Kleidunn_Jatlo_35.context: NodeContext: serious, determined - combat about to start

Adrielle_10.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_10.text: You're here! Mayrina was looking for you - she says it's urgent.

Adrielle_14.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_14.text: I'm an imbecile - the doll showed up days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?

Adrielle_29.speaker: Player
Adrielle_29.text: Hag, and their agents, are talented liars.

Adrielle_74.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_74.text: I fell for a hag's lies once, and in my arrogance was sure it would never happen again.

Adrielle_67.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_67.text: Blast it all - this is because of the book. I brought this on us all.

Adrielle_15.speaker: Player
Adrielle_15.text: Tell me - maybe I can help.

Adrielle_54.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_54.text: I was researching hags - and came upon their darkest secret.

Adrielle_98.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_98.text: A way to burn their bones to ash - and ensure they never return. No tricks, no come-backs - only the cold permanence of death.

Adrielle_27.speaker: Player
Adrielle_27.text: Tell me what it is, and I'll deal with the hag - don't worry.

Adrielle_2.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_2.text: Thank you - the redcap proved that I'm no match for a hag. Much to my shame.

Adrielle_95.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_95.text: There's a safe in the back - within is years worth of research. Kill her before she sends more of her monsters - I beg of you.
Adrielle_95.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Adrielle_62.speaker: Player
Adrielle_62.text: This is your problem, not mine.

Adrielle_57.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_57.text: Wait! My research has painted a target on my back - and the redcap proved I am no match for a hag.

Adrielle_66.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_66.text: There's a safe in the back with my life's work. I cannot bear to destroy it, but so long as it exists, I will be hunted. Take it - I beg of you.
Adrielle_66.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Adrielle_51.speaker: Player
Adrielle_51.text: I am not getting mixed up in this.

Adrielle_19.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_19.text: This attack is proof. Auntie Ethel knows we've discovered her darkest secret, a way to send her to death's cold embrace - for all eternity.

Adrielle_83.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_83.text: I spent a lifetime researching these vile creatures - but to my shame I'm no match for Ethel.

Adrielle_45.speaker: Player
Adrielle_45.text: Join me - I'll need all the help I can get.

Adrielle_42.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_42.text: I can't. If the dragonborn has shown me anything, it's that I'm not ready to face a hag - much to my shame.

Adrielle_63.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_63.text: There's a safe in the back - within is everything I know about hags and their abominations.

Adrielle_35.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_35.text: Kill Ethel before she seeks vengeance for her fallen redcap. Save us - I beg of you.
Adrielle_35.context: NodeContext: it hurts her pride to beg but she will do it if it means keeping her research safe

Adrielle_16.speaker: Player
Adrielle_16.text: So get out there and kill her. Don't sit here like cowards.

Adrielle_50.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_50.text: A doll was nearly our undoing - we have no chance against her, as much as it pains me to admit it.

Adrielle_96.speaker: Player
Adrielle_96.text: He mentioned a book - mean anything to you?

Adrielle_79.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_79.text: Yes. I am... painfully aware. But some good has come of this.

Adrielle_37.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_37.text: I'm glad you're here. I clearly lack the power to keep the hag, and her hexes, away from Mayrina.

Adrielle_84.speaker: Player
Adrielle_84.text: Have you seen a doll around here?

Adrielle_75.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_75.text: A doll? Hm. I saw a curious looking toy in some boxes upstairs, but I figured it the remnants of the previous tenants.

Adrielle_11.speaker: Player
Adrielle_11.text: You protected Mayrina until now - that's worth something.

Adrielle_24.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_24.text: You are kind, but I serve Helm - and failing to keep this hex from Mayrina is unforgivable in both his eyes and mine.
Adrielle_24.context: NodeContext: small smile at the player's kindness. but in her mind, everything is still  her fault

Adrielle_86.speaker: Player
Adrielle_86.text: I know Mayrina is hexed, but why a sheep?

Adrielle_82.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_82.text: Because to a hag, we are but lambs to her slaughter. We are mere toys - to be used and broken.

Adrielle_7.speaker: Player
Adrielle_7.text: Any idea how to remove the hex?

Adrielle_64.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_64.text: None. The magic originates from a hag's twisted lair - of that I am sure. But as to its cure, Helm has not revealed it to me.

Adrielle_56.speaker: Player
Adrielle_56.text: You should leave while you still can.

Adrielle_91.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_91.text: I was lost when Mayrina and I first met. Yet her courage reminded me of who I am - Helm's shield. I will not turn my back on her.
Adrielle_91.context: NodeContext: fiercely determined to help her friend

Adrielle_40.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_40.text: This is all my fault. Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn joined us. Why didn't I see it?

Adrielle_92.speaker: Player
Adrielle_92.text: Hag, and their agents, are liars and cheats by nature.

Adrielle_55.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_55.text: That's no excuse - I know what they're like, yet still I welcomed the dragonborn with open arms.
Adrielle_55.context: NodeContext: angry with herself - wishes she was 'better'

Adrielle_53.speaker: Player
Adrielle_53.text: You're lucky I was here to save your asses.

Adrielle_81.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_81.text: Mayrina was right about you. Thank you - for saving her when I couldn't.
Adrielle_81.context: NodeContext: sincere but also continuing to beat herself up for not being 'good enough'

Adrielle_0.speaker: Player
Adrielle_0.text: More than stupid - moronic. You endangered everyone.

Adrielle_32.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_32.text: I won't make the same mistake again - I swear it.

Adrielle_44.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_44.text: Should you ever have need of a cleric of Helm, I shall be there - you have my word.

Adrielle_48.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_48.text: Now is not the time for idle chatter - we need to find the doll!

Adrielle_88.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_88.text: We tried - the wretched thing followed us. We have no choice - we must find and destroy it. Before it consumes us all.

Adrielle_17.speaker: Player
Adrielle_17.text: I need info - where have you seen the doll?

Adrielle_26.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_26.text: Everywhere - inside boxes, under chairs. It could be anywhere.

Adrielle_9.speaker: Player
Adrielle_9.text: What did you do to piss of a hag?

Adrielle_49.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_49.text: There's so much blood. Mayrina! Check on Mayrina upstairs!
Adrielle_49.context: NodeContext: shock at the dead redcap, trying to gain conftrol of the situation. Directing the player upstairs.

Adrielle_59.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_59.text: I'm an imbecile - Mayrina was hexed mere days after the dragonborn appeared.

Adrielle_99.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_99.text: And now she's dead. Why didn't I see it? Why didn't I stop him? Damn it - damn it all!

Adrielle_68.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_68.text: The city feels different - like evil's embrace has lessened its vice.

Adrielle_61.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_61.text: The hag is dead, isn't she?

Adrielle_20.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_20.text: The city is still under threat, and the future is uncertain - but this is a victory for all that is good and kind.

Adrielle_36.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_36.text: My only regret is that Mayrina did not live to see this. But she want me to set aside my sorrow - and would also yell at me for 'ruining the mood'.

Adrielle_6.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_6.text: Never in my wildest dreams could I have bested the hag - thank you, my friend, for doing the impossible.

Adrielle_46.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_46.text: Helm is known as the Vigiliant One for good reason - while I could not see the hag, I could sense her. Now I feel roses where once there were thorns.

Adrielle_71.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_71.text: The hag could be anywhere in the city - find and kill her. I beg of you.
Adrielle_71.context: NodeContext: hates how powerless she feels

Adrielle_23.speaker: Player
Adrielle_23.text: I won't be killing Ethel. In fact, I've made a deal with her.

Adrielle_1.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_1.text: I'll send your head back to your mistress, you wretched scum.
Adrielle_1.context: NodeContext: serious, determined - combat about to start

Adrielle_78.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_78.text: When next I pray, you shall be the first name on my lips. Thank you.

Adrielle_85.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_85.text: You must stop the hag, or she'll never stop tormenting us. Please.
Adrielle_85.context: NodeContext: hpleading - hates how powerless she feels

Adrielle_89.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_89.text: Damn that hag - damn her to the Nine Hells.
Adrielle_89.context: NodeContext: dissapointed in herself that she 'let' this happen

Adrielle_97.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_97.text: Forgive me for raising a hand against you. The dragonborn worked hard to stoke our paranoia - yet the fiend was working for the hag this whole time.
Adrielle_97.context: NodeContext: horrified that she attacked the player and that she missed the truth about the dragonborn

Adrielle_28.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_28.text: That means Ethel knows I'm here - and that I have it. Helm protect me - I'm dead.
Adrielle_28.context: NodeContext: hint of fear as this dawns on her, building up to the last line

Adrielle_87.speaker: Player
Adrielle_87.text: I won't let that happen, I promise.

Adrielle_43.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_43.text: You carry Helm's strength and assurance - He sent you to me, I know it.

Adrielle_77.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_77.text: I discovered Ethel's darkest secret - a way to burn that witch for good. No more tricks, no more comebacks.

Adrielle_18.speaker: Adrielle
Adrielle_18.text: It's in a safe in the back - within lies everything I know about hags. Use that knowledge to kill Ethel, and free this world of her evil - I beg of you.
